intro: Diasperus neurocarpus, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and striking blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
